result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James A Bolin

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney Brian Braziel at $100/hr.  Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County by making payments of $35 beginning 11/04/2022 and every 30 days thereafter.  Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.
Letter to defendant with amended signature bond ordered by court 10/07/2022. Request to return signed bond and Affidavit of Witness form to Clerk of Court no later than 10/17/22.

Conditions: 
No contact with M.B. or M.B.'s residence.
No violent of abusive contact or acts/threats of violence toward anyone.

(clerk note that the condition of "Visitation/exchange to be arranged through a 3rd party" was mistakenly left off the bond that was signed)

ADDRESS INFO for James A Bolin
Current: 26270 274th Street, Holcombe, WI 54745 United States  (Effective: 10-03-2022)
Prior: 2919 Western Ave, Eau Claire, WI 54703

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
(Case called at 11:44 AM- by Zoom) Defendant James Bolin appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Ryan Kohler. ADA Tiffany Winter appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint. Defendant updates phone number and is eligible for Public Defender representation. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 10/24/2022 at 2:45 PM. 
Hearing: 11/16/2022 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions: 
No contact with M.B. or M.B.'s residence.
Visitation/exchange to be arranged through 3rd party.
Defendant not to have violent/abusive contact or acts/threats of violence toward anyone.
